From Harvard Appointment Office:
The following are copies of photo-static letters which Mr. Bardos brought to
this office:
Mr. Arthur Bardos has taught German at the University of Southern California
from 1946-1948. His personality and rich cultural background coupled with a
sound sense of pedagogy have earned for him the reputation of an effective and
popular teacher. Students have expressed to me grateful appreciation of the
courses which they have had under Mr. Brrdos. Among his colleagues at the University
Mr, Bardos enjoys the highest esteem. We respect his scholarship and we can
always count on his cooperatlveaess. I recommend Mr. Arthur Bardos without reservation.
Signed: Harold von Hofe, Chairman
Department of German
The Univ. of Southern California
University Park
June 4, 1948. Los Angeles, California
Mr. Arthur Bardos was employed in the capacity of Radio Control Officer by
Radio Branch of Information Control Division. Office of the Military Government
for Greater Hesse, from the summer of 1945 until September 1946. His duties
inclined the scrutinizing of scripts prepared for broadcasts, the writing of such
scripts in some instances, advising and guiding the German staff of Radio Frank¬
furt, particularly in the literary, editorial and features field, and the selection
of qualified Germans to fill leading positions in the radio station. During the months
of June and July he also acted as station chief and Chief of Radio Branch during the
absence of the permanent chief. Mr. Bardos* entire service with this organization was
performed in a superior manner. He returned to the States in September 1946 at his own
recuest. Signed: Herbert C. Gross, Capt. Inf.
Chief, Radio Branch
Information Control Division,
Radio Frankfurt.
September 15, 1946,
